The assertion ties a woman’s honor directly to her virginity, valorizing sexual inexperience as a matter of personal and familial reputation.
The frame elevates virginity as a moral purity criterion, implying that only a woman’s unspoiled (pure) status justifies refusal of sexual advances.
By restricting a woman’s right to refuse sex to only those who are virgins, the frame denies non-virgin women autonomy over their own bodies and sexual choices.
The statement creates unequal sexual rights, allowing only virgin women the equal power to reject unwanted advances while denying this right to others, enforcing a double standard.
The frame appeals to traditional patriarchal norms about chastity and deference to established moral orders, upholding hierarchical gender expectations.
